sub_title: Researcher / Lecturer Applied Data Science at Ambient Intelligence, Saxion University of Applied Sciences
summary:
A microbiologist/immunologist/geneticist turned researcher and teacher of applied (big) data science and applied machine learning / artificial intelligence.

My goal is to support the work of stakeholders across different fields by translating domain expert knowledge into functional and explainable data driven models that can be used for decision support.

While I enjoy working with all kinds of data, I do have a personal preference for projects based on data from "living beings", so health, medical, animal and (micro)biological data.
Go figure :)

Have done a lot of stuff, but in a nutshell, have: 
- 20+ years of experience (studying & working) in the fields of immunology, cell biology, molecular biology, microbiology/microbial ecology and genetics.
- 15+ years of experience (from my PhD research onward...) in data analysis, of which 5+ years in machine/deep learning.

profile_positions.description:
Researcher / Lecturer in Applied Data Science

Currently working and/or supervising students on the following, mostly data-driven, projects:

- AI-supported sensor systems for improving and competitive grading of horse and (disabled) rider bio-mechanical interaction - a KIEM 2020 project. As principal investigator in the project, I am responsible for the pilot analysis of horse - rider interaction data collected by the EquiMoves™ system. Target applications and follow-ups include:
• Improving horse and (disabled) rider interaction for riders of all skill levels;
• Objective evidence-based classification system for competitive grading of disabled riders in Para Dressage events;
• Identifying biomechanical irregularities for detecting and/or preventing injuries of horses.

- Design in IoT - a RAAK mkb project - in my role as "Methodology workgroup" leader, I am responsible for analysing existing best practices in IoT development, to develop new, or improve upon existing, methodologies for IoT development.

- Fostering the creation of regional (Overijssel, Gelderland) cooperative networks between industrial and academic partners (Cluster for digital monitoring of animal behaviour, animal health and animal welfare (x3D) - an EFRO project).

Past projects I was involved in:
- Use of Big Data technology for detecting the overexertion of athletes - a RAAK-publiek project.
- Predicting Legionella in cooling tower installations from live data (Data in Smart Industry - a RAAK-mkb project).
- Monitoring the dyke digging behaviour of protected (beavers) and invasive (coypu/nutria and muskrat) animal species (Dyke diggers in focus - a RAAK-publiek project).
- Integrating computer vision for safe, robust, accurate and reliable autonomous navigation of mobile industrial robots (Next-Generation Navigation - a RAAK-mkb project).
profile_positions.title: Researcher / Lecturer Applied Data Science

profile_positions.description:
Building models for simulating the effects of re-structuring the follow-up of breast cancer patients, taking into account the individual risks of recurrence, the wish of the patient on the organization of care, the burden for the patient and reduction of healthcare costs.
Datasets: IKNL Breast cancer registry
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

profile_positions.description:
a) Building models for simulating the effects of re-structuring the follow-up of breast cancer patients, taking into account the individual risks of recurrence, the wish of the patient on the organization of care, the burden for the patient and reduction of healthcare costs.
Datasets: IKNL Breast cancer registry

b) Building an artificial neural network model to predict the cytokine response in individuals from whom only genomic and/or metagenomic data are available. 
Datasets: Human functional genomics project

c) Use of predictive modeling tools (advanced statistics, machine learning) to aid in the identification of child abuse and child neglect.
Datasets: Structured and unstructured (including doctors' and nurses' free text notes) data collected by preventive child health care organizations (GGD Twente, GGD Amsterdam) of children between the ages zero and four at regular consultation visits.

d) Applying data mining and machine learning techniques on national surveys of child health data to identify patterns useful for early detection of autism spectrum disorders.
Example dataset:  United States of America 2011-2012 National Survey of Children's Health (NCSH)
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

profile_positions.description:
a)	Identification of patterns with healthcare improvement potential in datasets collected from Dutch cancer patients.
Primary dataset: DICA-DSCA (Dutch Surgical Colorectal Audit)

b)	Investigating the risk of individual re-identification in (partially) anonymized datasets collected from Dutch cancer patients.
Primary dataset: DICA-DLCA (Dutch Lung Cancer Audit)

company.name: UKM Uniklinikum Muenster, Pediatric Rheumatology and Immunology

profile_positions.description:
Coordinating S100 protein assay analyses for MIAMI consortium partners, mainly calprotectin (MRP8/14) and calgranulin (S100A12)
MIAMI = Monitoring Innate immunity in Arthritis and Mucosal Inflammation, a research consortium funded by EU Grant HEALTH-F2-2012-305266

Management of ICON serum samples biobank
ICON = Inception Cohort Of Newly-diagnosed patients with Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
- JIA biomarker discovery

Management of Inflammatory Bowel Disease serum and stool samples biobank
- IBD biomarker discovery

Establishing animal (mouse) models for Kawasaki disease
- via injection of bacterial and fungal derivatives
- via injection of synthetic, innate immune receptor specific molecules

profile_positions.description:
Establishing animal (mouse) models for celiac disease:

- dietary sensibilization by gluten abstinence

profile_positions.title: Parental leave

profile_positions.description:
Marie Curie TRACKS (Transglutaminases: role in pathogenesis, diagnosis and therapy) 

Main responsibility:
To produce and purify large quantities of following compounds for partner laboratories in the TRACKS research network:
•	Recombinant tissue transglutaminase 2 enzyme (TG2)
•	Miniantibodies against TG2
•	GST-tagged putative interactors of TG2
Non TG2 related
•	Production and purification of Fc-prion fusion proteins and recombinant anti prion mini-antibodies

Research work: 
•	Anti-idiotypic response towards antibodies against TG2 present in the sera of celiac disease patients
•	Antiangiogenic effect of antibodies against TG2
•	Studies on prion structure and biology

Technical expertise gained:
•	Phage display
•	Transfection of mammalian cell culture lines (CHO-S)
•	Use of the CELLine™ cell cultivation system
•	Use of ÄKTAprime™ automated liquid chromatography system
•	Co-immunoprecipitation
•	Angiogenesis models using HUVEC cells (2D – fibronectin, 3D – matrigel)

Routine use of:
•	PCR, cloning, bacterial transformation
•	Cell culture (suspension, adherent)
•	Affinity purification of recombinant proteins (ÄKTAprime, gravity flow columns)
•	SDS-PAGE, Western Blotting
•	ELISA

Additional skills gained:
•	Organizing and executing production and validation of specific products for end users
profile_positions.title: Marie Curie Experienced Researcher (Postdoctoral position)

profile_positions.description:
Research on:
• Chicken monocytes and heterophil response to Mycoplasma sp.
• Phage display chicken antibody library against M. synoviae proteins
• Phage display chicken antibody library against antigens of H5N1 and H5N2 avian influenza virus

Use and manipulation of: 
• Basic microbial culture techniques (bacteria, mycoplasma)
• Blood collection techniques from chickens
• Primary cell cultures derived from chicken blood
• Transformed cell cultures of avian (chicken, quail) origin
• Cell proliferation assays
• Nitric oxide secretion assays
• Chicken tissues
• RNA isolation, purification and stabilization techniques from various tissues and cells
• Microarray technology for studying the response of the innate immunity
• Quantitative real time RT-PCR for validating microarray results
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Chicken immunocompetent cell response to avian respiratory pathogens, their proteins and Toll-like receptor ligands 
• PhD thesis title “Molecular characterization of chicken immunocompetent cell response to haemagglutinins isolated from Mycoplasma synoviae“  
• Supervised by Prof. Mojca Narat and Dr. Dusan Bencina

Use and manipulation of: 
• Basic microbial culture techniques for culturing E. coli and M. synoviae
• Native M. synoviae protein and lipoprotein extraction methods
• Techniques for producing M. synoviae recombinant proteins in E. coli expression system
• Blood collection techniques from chickens and mice
• Primary cell cultures derived from chicken and mouse blood
• Transformed cell cultures of avian (chicken, quail) and mammalian (mouse, bovine) origin
• Cell proliferation assays
• Nitric oxide secretion assays
• Phage display antibody library

Teaching assistant:
• Immunology
• Immune techniques
• Genomics

Global transcriptional response of chicken macrophages infected by M. synoviae or E. coli or exposed to various M. synoviae protein fractions or isolated VlhA protein

Use and manipulation of:
